<#C06RS373V6G|build-frontend>
*Hey team.* 

On trying to set up the frontend environment, I found that create-react-app is deprecated. While it’s certainly possible to set up a standalone React app from scratch, I have reconsidered and think it would be smarter both in the immediate and in the long run to use Next.js.

Some reasons:

*Sustainability and Future-proofing*: With CRA being deprecated, it’s clear that the ecosystem is moving towards more integrated solutions. Next.js is actively maintained, offering long-term sustainability and aligning with modern web development practices. Any new releases of React or other tools will likely be made with the assumption that a framework will be used

*Improved Documentation and Community Support*: Future devs working on the project will most likely find more and better resources for a Next.js app than a standalone React one.

*Handling Complexity*: Equalify’s number of features and therefore its complexity are growing rapidly. Next.js provides tools to handle complex API interactions and things like dynamic content rendering.

*Developer experience*: Particularly without CRA, Next.js is much easier to set up than a standalone React app. Also, there are a ton of features and optimizations that make the development more speedy.

*SEO*: Server side rendering is good for SEO, client side is not.

*RESERVATIONS*:

*Hosting*: Really my only concern now about using Next is that is would require a separate server than the PHP one. Which shouldn’t be too much of a problem, it’s very easy to host on Next on Vercel, which comes with automatic optimizations like deployment previews, auto-scaling, load-balancing, etc.

I’m feeling pretty strongly that Next is the way to go on this, but I am open to discussion. Please let me know your thoughts!

attachments.text:
*Authentication*

☐ Requires users to be logged in to access. (Redirect to Auth0 to login)

*Views*

The frontend will include views.

*“Discovery”*

☐ List of properties
☐ Includes Modal to add new properties via form or CSV

Uses `get/properties` API query.

*“Property Settings”*

☐ Form to up property name, url, and scan type

Uses `get/properties` API query.

*“Scans”*

☐ List of queued scans

Uses `get/scans` API query.

*“Reports”*

☐ List of Reports with a button to edit each report.

Uses `get/reports` API query.

*“Single Report”*

☐ A single report page with timeline of node updates, messages, tags, and pages components.
☐ Includes button to edit report.

Uses `get/reports` and `get/results` API query.

*“Report Settings”*

☐ Form to update report name and filters

Uses `get/reports` API query.

*“Single Message”*

☐ Report page that is focused on messages includes timeline of node updates and list of nodes related to the message.
☐ Inherits filters from report if a user clicks to Single Messages from a Single Report view.

Uses `get/reports` and `get/results` API query.

*“Single Tag”*

☐ Report page that is focused on tags with timeline of node updates and list of messages with the tag.
☐ Inherits filters from report if a user clicks to Single Tag from a Single Report view.

Uses `get/reports` and `get/results` API query.

*“Single URL”*

☐ Report page that is focused on ruls with timeline of node updates and list of messages related to the URL.
☐ Inherits filters from report if a user clicks to Single URL from a Single Report view.

Uses `get/reports` and `get/results` API query.

*Actions*

The frontend will include actions:

*Add Single Property*

☐ Inserts new property info from the form.
☐ Triggered by Single Property Entry Form button in modal on Discovery view
☐ Passes info to `/add/properties`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Add Multiple Properties*

☐ Inserts multiple new properties from the CSV
☐ Triggered by Upload Form button in modal on Discovery view
☐ CSV is validated to be a valid CSV with proper fields and reformatted to work with API call.
☐ Passes info to `/add/properties`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Save Property Settings*

☐ Updates Property Info
☐ Triggered by “Save Property” button on Property Settings view
☐ Passes propertyID and updates to `/update/properties`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Delete Property*

☐ Removes property and all related content
☐ Triggered by “Delete Property” button on Property Settings view
☐ Requires confirmation before deletion: "All data related to your property will be removed. That includes all nodes and node updates. Are you sure you want to continue?"
☐ Passes propertyID to `/update/properties`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Add Report*

☐ Adds a new report and relevant filters
☐ Triggered by “Save Report” button on Report Settings view if it's a new report
☐ Passes relevant info to `/add/reports`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Update Report*

☐ Updates a report and relevant filters
☐ Triggered by “Save Report” button on Report Settings view if it's an existing report
☐ Passes relevant info to `/update/reports`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Delete Report*

☐ Deletes a report and relevant filters
☐ Triggered by “Delete Report” button on Report Settings view if it's an existing report
☐ Passes relevant info to `/delete/reports`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Add URL to Scan Queue:*

☐ Add Scan to Scan queue
☐ Triggered by “Scan URL” button on Scan Detail view
☐ Passes urlID to `/add/scans`
☐ Return success/failure alert with message

*Components*

The following are reusable components. Note: Old component markup is available here: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/tree/main/components|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/tree/main/components>

*Timeline*

☐ Inherits view data from `get/results`
☐ Displays chart of nodes equalified over time.
☐ Using <https://www.chartjs.org|https://www.chartjs.org>

*Messages List*

☐ Inherits view data from `get/results`
☐ Displays list of messages with count of equalified and active nodes related to each message.
☐ Each row links to related Single Message view.

*Tags List*

☐ Inherits view data from `get/results`
☐ Displays list of tags
☐ Each row links to related Single Tag view.

*URL List*

☐ Inherits view data from `get/results`
☐ Displays list of urls
☐ Each row links to related Single URL view.

*Node List*

☐ Inherits view data from `get/results`
☐ Displays list of nodes

*Accessibility Requirements*

☐ Maintain WCAG 2.2 Level AA Standards
☐ Perform user tests - Feel free to ping <https://github.com/kevinandrews1|@kevinandrews1> to perform user testing.
